story.value: TheCheshireKat appears to you and asks if you'd like to go on an adventure: type !explore to see where she'll lead you.
On the path before you lies a !Locket, !Book, and !ButterKnife; which one do you carry with you on your journey, $user?
You have chosen to carry the Butter Knife
You have chosen to carry the Locket
You have chosen to carry the Book
You have been lead to a fork in the road, do you take the !left or !right path?

As you walk down the left pathway, the trees close in and you suddenly lose track of where you are. You've been walking in circles for hours and a field rat has cut a hole in your pocket and scurried off with some of your key fragments! Better luck next time, adventurers!

As you walk down the left pathway, the trees close in and you suddenly lose track of where you are.You've been walking in circles for hours and a field rat has cut a hole in your pocket. Luckily you caught the rat and he didn’t make off with your key fragments! You lucky adventurer - glad you had that locket with you!
As you walk down the left pathway it starts to get darker and more confusing, but you were smart enough to leave a trail of mushrooms to guide your way back to TheCheshireKat!
You continue down the left pathway and somehow make it to a clearing where there is a golden box. You pick up the box and now you have some extra key fragments! Well done, adventurer!!
Before you can step onto the left pathway you’re scooped up by the Bandersnatch: will you !fight or try to !run?
Congratulations! You’ve won the fight against the Bandersnatch! You trade his left eye for some key fragments in town! Well fought, adventurer!
Oh no!! You’ve lost to the Bandersnatch! He left a gash on your arm and you have to give up some key fragments to a healer in town! Hope the wound heals in time for our next adventure!
You’ve outsmarted the Bandersnatch by hiding underneath a fallen log! You’re safe for now and you’ve made your way back to the beginning of the path!
You’ve outsmarted the Bandersnatch by hiding underneath a fallen log! You’re safe for now and you’ve made your way back to the beginning of the path!
The Bandersnatch caught you and left a gash on your arm. Now you have to give up give key fragments to a healer in town! Hope the wound heals in time for our next adventure!

You walk down the right pathway to a small, seemingly uninhabited house and hear loud clattering behind it. As you explore the area you find a tea party taking place!! Do you sit by the !madhatter or the !marchhare?
You take a seat by the Mad Hatter and he asks you to solve the riddle, “why is a raven like a writing desk?
You’re too puzzled to figure out the riddle so he asks you to leave and you end up wandering back to TheCheshireKat

You read in your book and respond that a raven is like a writing book because Poe wrote on both! The Mad Hatter is impressed and pours you a cup of tea and hands you (random # of) key fragments!! Great job, adventurer!
